_comment: This file is generated. Please edit .homeycompose/app.json instead.

description.en: Connect your Hyundai or Kia smart car.

title.en: The tire pressure alarm turned off

titleFormatted.en: The tire pressure alarm turned off

title.en: The tire pressure alarm turned on

titleFormatted.en: The tire pressure alarm turned on

example.en: White House Meridian, 1600, Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia, 20500, United States

title.en: Disable Homey control and live data

hint.en: Car name as per manufacturer.
Car ID as per manufacturer.
Car VIN as per manufacturer.
Full EV (Electric Vehicle), PHEV (Plugin Hybrid Electric Vehicle), or HEV/ICE (Hybrid Electric Vehicle/Internal Combustion Engine)

Interval for checking the server for a status change.
Attention: Homey will only receive status updates from the car when you park the car, or by doing a manual refresh!
WARNING: A low poll interval can get you locked out of the server!

Interval for checking the car status while the engine is on.
Attention: for Homey to know that the engine is on, a manual refresh or cloud refresh must be performed!
WARNING: A low poll interval can get you locked out of the server!
Disable this function by setting the time to 0.

Interval for checking the car status also when the engine is off.
WARNING: This will drain your 12V battery fast!
A low poll interval can get you locked out of the server
Disable this function by setting the time to 0.

label.en: Start status refresh via cloud (HTTP GET)

hint.en: Enter any unique secret (numbers and normal characters only). Leave empty to disable cloud refresh.
The cloud refresh URL is very long and difficult to type into your phone automation app. A short URL can be created for you using Bitly. Attention: Bitly gathers statistics when this link is used.

After entering a secret, you can force a car refresh by calling this website (HTTP GET). This can be usefull when you want to automatically start updates when your phone connects to the car's bluetooth.
ABRP interface only works for EV/PHEV vehicles. Get a token from the ABRP app. Settings > Detailed > Car model > Car settings > Link Homey > copy the token.
Home location is used to calculate the car's distance.
Home location is used to calculate the car's distance.

Using Google Directions will improve Estimated Time To Home (ETTH) calculations, including real-time traffic.
Get a key at https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/directions/get-api-key.
Leave empty to disable Google Directions.
Homey will raise an alarm when the 12V battery charge is below this level.
Homey will raise an alarm when the EV battery charge is below this level.
